B1 (of liquid) turned into ice: They skated over the frozen lake.frozen solid The river is frozen solid for weeks in winter.
Frozen food has been preserved by freezing: We don't have any fresh vegetables, only frozen peas. Dinner was a frozen pizza.
Frozen ground is very hard because the liquid in it has turned to ice: Winter is a good time to plant trees, but make sure the ground is not frozen.
B1 If a person, or a part of their body is frozen, they are, or it is, very cold: I'm frozen - could you close the window?frozen stiff After walking through the snow, my feet were frozen stiff. Synonym
freezing

not moving at all or feeling unable to move, usually because of fear: He was too frozen with fear to do anything. She felt frozen, unable to decide which way to go. Their mouths were frozen in expressions of shock.

when food is frozen, it is stored at a very low temperature in order to keep it fresh: He started a business that supplied frozen food to caterers.
FINANCE when a bank account, etc. is frozen, it is not able to be used because of a government or court order: Court bailiffs have ordered that the company's bank accounts be frozen while the fraud charge is investigated.
